issue.title: [JBTM-3656] XTS TestBA error: Runtime jboss-as was not killed by Byteman
issue.body:
https://issues.redhat.com/browse/JBTM-3656
https://issues.redhat.com/browse/JBTM-3612
https://issues.redhat.com/browse/JBTM-3616

The error message is: Runtime jboss-as was not killed by Byteman, this indicates a test failure
According to my research some threads are not getting killed after the byteman command (https://github.com/jbosstm/narayana/blob/master/XTS/localjunit/crash-recovery-tests/src/main/java/com/arjuna/qa/extension/JBossAS7ServerKillProcessor.java#L15)
I think those threads get blocked in a try-catch loop without exiting when byteman executes 'xargs kill' on the jboss as process

JDK17  XTS
!CORE !TOMCAT !AS_TESTS  !RTS !JACOCO  !QA_JTA !QA_JTS_OPENJDKORB !PERF !LRA !DB_TESTS !mysql !db2 !postgres !oracle

issue.title: [JBTM-3656] XTS TestBA error: Runtime jboss-as was not killed by Byteman
issue.body:
https://issues.redhat.com/browse/JBTM-3656
https://issues.redhat.com/browse/JBTM-3612
https://issues.redhat.com/browse/JBTM-3616

The error message is: Runtime jboss-as was not killed by Byteman, this indicates a test failure
According to my research some threads are not getting killed after the byteman command (https://github.com/jbosstm/narayana/blob/master/XTS/localjunit/crash-recovery-tests/src/main/java/com/arjuna/qa/extension/JBossAS7ServerKillProcessor.java#L15)
I think those threads get blocked in a try-catch loop without exiting when byteman executes 'xargs kill' on the jboss as process

JDK17  XTS

issue.title: [JBTM-3656] XTS TestBA error: Runtime jboss-as was not killed by Byteman
issue.body:
https://issues.redhat.com/browse/JBTM-3656
https://issues.redhat.com/browse/JBTM-3612
https://issues.redhat.com/browse/JBTM-3616

The error message is: Runtime jboss-as was not killed by Byteman, this indicates a test failure
According to my research some threads are not getting killed after the byteman command (https://github.com/jbosstm/narayana/blob/master/XTS/localjunit/crash-recovery-tests/src/main/java/com/arjuna/qa/extension/JBossAS7ServerKillProcessor.java#L15)
I think those threads get blocked in a try-catch loop without exiting when byteman executes 'xargs kill' on the jboss as process

JDK17  XTS
!CORE !TOMCAT !AS_TESTS  !RTS !JACOCO  !QA_JTA !QA_JTS_OPENJDKORB !PERF !LRA !DB_TESTS !mysql !db2 !postgres !oracle

issue.body:
https://issues.redhat.com/browse/JBTM-3656
https://issues.redhat.com/browse/JBTM-3612
https://issues.redhat.com/browse/JBTM-3616

The error message is: Runtime jboss-as was not killed by Byteman, this indicates a test failure
According to my research some threads are not getting killed after the byteman command (https://github.com/jbosstm/narayana/blob/master/XTS/localjunit/crash-recovery-tests/src/main/java/com/arjuna/qa/extension/JBossAS7ServerKillProcessor.java#L15)
I think those threads get blocked in a try-catch loop without exiting when byteman executes 'xargs kill' on the jboss as process

https://issues.redhat.com/browse/JBTM-3656
https://issues.redhat.com/browse/JBTM-3612
https://issues.redhat.com/browse/JBTM-3616

The error message is: Runtime jboss-as was not killed by Byteman, this indicates a test failure
According to my research some threads are not getting killed after the byteman command (https://github.com/jbosstm/narayana/blob/master/XTS/localjunit/crash-recovery-tests/src/main/java/com/arjuna/qa/extension/JBossAS7ServerKillProcessor.java#L15)
I think those threads get blocked in a try-catch loop without exiting when byteman executes 'xargs kill' on the jboss as process

JDK17  XTS
!CORE !TOMCAT !AS_TESTS  !RTS !JACOCO  !QA_JTA !QA_JTS_OPENJDKORB !PERF !LRA !DB_TESTS !mysql !db2 !postgres !oracle

issue.title: [JBTM-3656] XTS TestBA error: Runtime jboss-as was not killed by Byteman
issue.body:
https://issues.redhat.com/browse/JBTM-3656
https://issues.redhat.com/browse/JBTM-3612
https://issues.redhat.com/browse/JBTM-3616

The error message is: Runtime jboss-as was not killed by Byteman, this indicates a test failure
According to my research some threads are not getting killed after the byteman command (https://github.com/jbosstm/narayana/blob/master/XTS/localjunit/crash-recovery-tests/src/main/java/com/arjuna/qa/extension/JBossAS7ServerKillProcessor.java#L15)
I think those threads get blocked in a try-catch loop without exiting when byteman executes 'xargs kill' on the jboss as process

JDK17  XTS
!CORE !TOMCAT !AS_TESTS  !RTS !JACOCO  !QA_JTA !QA_JTS_OPENJDKORB !PERF !LRA !DB_TESTS !mysql !db2 !postgres !oracle

issue.body:
https://issues.redhat.com/browse/JBTM-3656
https://issues.redhat.com/browse/JBTM-3612
https://issues.redhat.com/browse/JBTM-3616

The error message is: Runtime jboss-as was not killed by Byteman, this indicates a test failure
According to my research some threads are not getting killed after the byteman command (https://github.com/jbosstm/narayana/blob/master/XTS/localjunit/crash-recovery-tests/src/main/java/com/arjuna/qa/extension/JBossAS7ServerKillProcessor.java#L15)
I think those threads get blocked in a try-catch loop without exiting when byteman executes 'xargs kill' on the jboss as process
